title: Log Analysis Challenge 1
instructions:
During a recent system compromise investigation, the Security Operations Center at Esquelle Eye Care discovered a critical oversightâ€”the SIEM forwarding agent had never been installed on their corporate website's web server. This mistake left the web server's log data unmonitored.

A System Administrator managed to extract the Apache access log file from the server and has sent it to you for analysis. Your task is to review the challenge.log file to determine the extent of the compromise, its origin, the attack vector, and the vulnerability that led to the incident.

Challenge File:

  • 04_SIEM/01_Log_Analysis/Challenges/challenge.log

questions.question: How many total events were logged in the file?
questions.hint: The wc command can be useful here.

questions.question: What is the full timestamp of the last event in the file?
questions.hint: The tail command can be used to print the last few lines in a file. Pair it with -n to specify the number of lines you want to pull back.

questions.question: What are the top 3 IP addresses found within the log file (in descending order)?
questions.hint: Refer to the trick to extract (cut) columns and sort their unique values.

questions.question: What is the count of the IP address with the highest connections?
How many different user agent strings are found in the log file?
questions.hint: Refer to the trick to extract (cut) columns and sort their unique values.

questions.question: Which user agent string sticks out as suspicious?
questions.hint: Look for subtle mispellings or typos that may suggest an attacker is trying to impersonate a benign string.
correct_answers: Mozilla/5.0 (Widows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/126.0.0.0 Safari/537.36

questions.question: What is the line number of the log event that returned an HTTP status code of 404?
What web-based attack can you identify based on the URL query parameters?
What is the name of the vulnerable URL parameter?
questions.hint: A question mark in a URL signifies the beginning of a query string, which is used to pass data to other web applications. A URL parameter is typically constructed of a key (name) and a corresponding value pair.

questions.question: The attacker attempted a number of different SQL injection attacks. Based on other indicators in the event logs, what was the full timestamp of the potentially successful attempt?
questions.hint: Look for anomalies such as sudden changes in HTTP response behavior, including status codes or response length, which can indicate a successful attack compared to failed attempts.
